candidate_sites.parking_access: Limited street parking; relies on foot + transit

candidate_sites.address: 70 University Ave E, Waterloo, ON (student corridor)
candidate_sites.transit_access: High bus frequency, heavy student foot traffic at night

score_definition.walkability_score: 1-10. How easy it is for people to reach this block on foot (students, office workers, nightlife). High walkability means spontaneous food stops without needing parking.
score_definition.foot_traffic_score: 1-10. How many people are physically passing by daily / per weekend. Boosted by transit stops, events, and pedestrian-focused planning. Waterloo Region has focused investment on walkable Uptown Waterloo and Kitchener Market areas, which increases foot-based spending.
score_definition.nearby_competitor_count: Number of similar fast-casual burger / fried / sandwich / late-night spots within ~500m. High competition can split demand.
score_definition.safety_score: 1-10. Perceived comfort for casual diners / families at night. Lower score might scare off certain customer types even if foot traffic is high.
score_definition.suitability_score: 1-100. Overall recommendation for THIS industry (fast casual burger). Combines traffic, walkability, safety, saturation, and size fit.
